channel.title: Lab/Homework Exercises on PSU Astro 528
channel.description: Recent content in Lab/Homework Exercises on PSU Astro 528

item.title: Lab 1: Tools & Fundamentals
item.description: Lab 1: Tools & Fundamentals: Floating Point Arithmetic, Functions, Tests (Due Sept 2) Exercise 1: Get started using core development tools ICDS-ACI portal git GitHub.com Julia Pluto Notebooks Exercise 2: Floating Point Arithmetic, Functions, Tests Exercise 3: Personal Goals (save at least 15 minutes for this one) If you’re waiting on getting your account on ICDS-ACI, then I’d suggest that you start with exercise 3, since thinking about your goals does not require any accounts or special software.

item.title: Lab 2: Best Practices
item.description: Lab 2: Best Practices: Assertions, Unit Testing, Continuous Integrations, Benchmarking (due Sept 9) Exercise 1: Benchmarking, Big-O Analysis, Compute vs Memory Limits Exercise 2: Numerical Stability of N-body Exercise 3: Assertions, Unit Tests & Continuous Integration Testing Lessons / Resources Getting Started with Julia on ACI Starting & Submitting Assignments Julia Resources Packages used Documentation for DifferentialEquations.jl

item.title: Lab 3: Memory Hierarchy
item.description: Lab 3: Memory Access, Disk I/O, DataFrames (due Sept 16) Exercise 1: Dense Matrix-Vector Multiply: Optimizing serial code, Memory access paterns, Benchmarking Exercise 2: Benchmarking File I/O (no Python dependencies) Exercise 2: Benchmarking File I/O (& Calling Python Packages) Lessons / Resources Details for this class Getting Started with Julia on ACI Starting & Submitting Assignments Julia Julia Manual Think Julia: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist Learn Julia in Y Minutes File Formats FITSIO library written in C HDF5 Apache Arrow Julia packages for reading files Julia’s FileIO.

item.title: Lab 4: Probabilistic Programming
item.description: Lab 4: Higher-level Languages & Probabilistic Programming (due Sept 23) Exercise 1: Auto-differentiation & Optimization (as in minimization/maximization of a function) Exercise 2: Probabilistic Programming Language Resources Autodifferentiation ForwardDiff.jl DiffResults.jl ReverseDiff.jl Zygote.jl Model Fitting Optim.jl LsqFit.jl GLM.jl Minimization Algorithms [Gradient Descent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gradient_descent Downhill Simplex BFGS Probabilistic Programming Turing.jl MCMCChains.jl Soss.jl Sampling Algorithms NUTS

item.title: Lab 5: Serial Optimization
item.description: Lab 5: Serial Optimization: Profiling & Optimization Patterns (due Sept 30) Exercise 1: Profiling & Reducing Memory Allocations Exercise 2: Code Inspection & Type Stability
